intro: Cassipourea myriocarpa, commonly known as the red sanders, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, aromatic wood with a reddish hue. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small white flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its high demand in the furniture industry, it is also listed as an endangered species.
